alert.note: Alert for Inland Collier County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 3:16PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Collier and north central Mainland Monroe Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 316 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud over Big Cypress National Preserve, or 19 miles northeast of Chokoloskee, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Big Cypress National Preserve, Dade-Collier Training Airport and Deep Lake. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows.

area.areaDesc: Inland Collier County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Mainland Monroe
